Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 09:26PM akitalover wrote: JENNI- My husband just left for his road trip to Oregon...my first chemo went almost perfect. I am a little tired and flushed is all. So far so good. ..sorry your treatment was so rough. I think it depends on the different meds as well. I didn't see what they gave you..I was given TC today and the nurses were wonderful and went real slow to avoid any reactions and headaches, etc..I have an HMO that I had switched to recently, and I must say that I am very happy with all of my surgeons and treatment so far.
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 09:41PM akitalover wrote: algreach- maybe I will calm down a little bit...I'm just waiting for a "se" to kick in. I just got back from my first treatment and I am a little tired and flushed. Yeah, it is kinda cool about my son. He's adorable too. He is going to take good care of his Mama. He lives downtown San Diego,so will take the train up the coast to see me and shave my hair this weekend. My nurses advised me to do it..told me my scalp would get itchy and dry before fall out.. then we will go to Pt.Loma to check out the ACS wigs...I was told that SE will start day 7..so much information..good luck to all.we will get through this ..I am so lucky to have my beautiful white Akita, Christina by my side. She licked me over and over and I told me husband that maybe I have cancer....I got my butt into my missed mammogram appointment and guess what???? Now that is a true dog story!! Feel better
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 10:20PM akitalover wrote: kittykat- You go girl!!!Make sure your nurse goes slow with the C tomorrow so you don't have a sinus headache for 5 days, and she can wrap your IV had in a heating pad because it can cause pain going in...they probabaly know their job..but just in case..ya never know after what you've been through.. just sit back and relax! good luck!( I had my first day of TC today, no problemo)
